## 5.5

Approximate the following functions by using MLP:

a) f(x1, x2) = max(c(exp(-(x1^2)), exp(-2 * (x2^2)), (2 * exp(-0.5 * (x1^2 * x2^2))) ) )

```{r}

# Função para aproximação

fx <-  function(x1_list, x2_list) {

  index <- 1
  x_list <- c()

  for (x1 in x1_list){
    x2 <- x2_list[[index]]
    x <- max(c(exp(-(x1^2)), exp(-2 * (x2^2)), (2 * exp(-0.5 * ((x1^2) * (x2^2)))) ) )
    x_list <- c(x_list,x)
    index <- index + 1
}
  return(x_list)
} 


# Dataset de treino

x1 <- (10*runif(5000))
x2 <- (10*runif(5000))
y <- fx(x1,x2)

df_train <- data.frame(x1,x2)

# Dataset de teste

x11 <- (10*runif(1000))
x22 <- (10*runif(1000))
df_test <-  data.frame(x11,x22)
y_test <- fx(x11,x22)


# Rede Neural com um hidden layer, 6 neurons e 40 iterações

nn <- nnet(df_train, y, size=6, maxit=40, linout=TRUE)

y_pred <- predict(nn, df_test)

df <- data.frame(x11,x22, y_test, y_pred)
```
